body: @Lulububu do you get any console errors?

The only message I get is "The character encoding of the HTML document was not declared. The document will render with garbled text in some browser configurations if the document contains characters from outside the US-ASCII range. The character encoding of the page must be declared in the document or in the transfer protocol.".

But it doesn't seem related.
I tried other version of firefox. It does work on 35 but does not on 30 (and 31 of course).
Confirming the issue -- FF v31.3 (Linux) and v31.4 (Windows) don't display anything or log any errors. Pointing Chrome v37 at the same running app displays the chart as expected.

Can confirm, v31.5.0 on Linux is not working and gives no console errors

![Chart](http://i.imgur.com/512PXqb.png)

However, I did notice that http://chartjs.github.io/Chart.js/ was working in v31.5.0, which relies on v1.0.2 Chart.js
Chart.js is not supported until Firefox 35, which was released Jan 13, 2015. Anyone who is still using an earlier version of Firefox will not have Chart.js support.

Examples are working in FF 25 if `responsive: false` (and jquery related code removed). So might simply be the responsive implementation which need to be fixed?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3874900/15359300/f2af3ea8-1d08-11e6-82fc-6653073bd9a6.png)
It doesn't work on firefox 24.7.0 under linux too ...
Is there a fix for this? We only have access to Firefox 31.5.0. Or do we know what is causing the compatibility issues?

@Lulububu @mbgardner @jeffshaver can you guys test if that [this dev version](https://github.com/chartjs/Chart.js/files/280527/Chart.bundle.min.js.zip) works for you? It works for me on FF 25 & FF 31 (@nelsou I didn't test on FF 24).

It does work on FF 31.
Thanks !
Anyone know when this will make it into a release?
It will be in the next release which is coming very soon, probably within a few days.
